result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Lee Kuhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler Lee Kuhn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler Lee Kuhn was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 through 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 5, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation but must petition the Court.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT with Grant Dockendorf, Dolores Wiedner or Anne Lutterman.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for good time.
Huber granted for work.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John Kucinski, DF: Tyler Lee Kuhn appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:53 p.m.  Set SEHR.  State argues sentencing.  Attorney Kucinski makes argument.  DE makes statement.  Crt Orders:

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox,  ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Tyler Lee Kuhn appeared. Includes 15CM15 and 15CM29.  There is an agreement.   Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 15CM29. Def pleads guilty. Court dismisses counts 2, 3, 4 in 15CM29. Court dismisses 15CM15. 
Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1 in 15CM29. 
Court orders: S/W 1 year probation with conditions: 
- $243.00 court costs. Payment plan in approved. 
- AODA and follow all recommendations
- Absolute Sobriety
- No contact with Grant D, Anne L and Dolores W. 
Def to sign up for probation today, Bond continues until signed up. Def advised of right to appeal. 
Eligible for expungement under 973.015, if probation is successful and upon def request.
Appointing Atty Andrea. km

Attorney Andrea advises the court there is no agreement.  Attorney Andrea needs discovery for 15CM29.  Continue PTC.  Bail is continued. per EFV 1/28/15.eif
Per EFV 1/28/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference on January 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant to be held until 3:30 p.m. today STC with Judge Eric J. Lundell

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Grant D., Anne L. or Dolores W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
